content.description: Pitch 1 ascends a ~4" wide crack for about 40 feet and then meanders straight up past featured rock with intermittent cracks for gear.  Belay below an angling left corner. Pitch two ascends the corner moving first to the left then back right until you reach ther top.
content.protection: No fixed gear. Descend by down-climbing an exposed 3rd class face with jugs to a ledge.
content.location: Route is located on a face (with south / southwest exposure) to the left (or west) of the gully between the upper and lower formations.

content.description: This route wanders up the face in the middle of the wall, between Desert Highway and Roadkill.  Gain the horizontal dike a short ways up, traverse right and then climb up to intermittent cracks (10a) that lead to a short, right-facing corner.  Belay at the top of the corner. The second pitch heads up easier rock to the top.
content.protection: Small pro to 2 inches.  RPs might be useful.  No fixed gear.
content.location: Look for the horizontal dikes to the right of the gully system that separates the main face from the smaller buttress of Beep-Beep and Cuckoo.

content.description:
Pitch 1: Climb the middle area of the lower formation.

Pitch 2: Meander up to the top finding intermittent cracks for gear.
content.location: Roadrunner Rock consists of two formations: a lower triangular shaped south / southeast facing formation (separated by a gully) from the upper and larger east facing formation.

content.description:
Pitch 1: Climb the right side of the lower formation.

Pitch 2: Keep trending left to the top finding intermittent cracks for gear.

Rap from horns a-top the lower formation, ~150 feet.
